page.title: 17Communications
page.content: The main means of communications for the people of Littlebeck, Sneatonthorpe and the farms on the moors is the telephone. The telephone wires are overhead and during the winter, when the snow is very heavy communications are very often cut off. Many farmers now have Citizens Band radios and are able to communicate with each other when the telephone system is out of order. Most people in the area now have television and video recorders but reception in Littlebeck is limited to some houses under the hill and only one television channel is obtainable. There is, however, an aerial to improve the service.
